page.title: 16CLIMATE IN PRIVETT AREA
page.content: This is a lovely part of Hampshire in which to live. On clear days the view stretches to the Solent in the South and the Berkshire downs in the North. These wide horizons provide wonderful cloud formations and breathtaking evening skies. Breezes blow more or less all year round and in Winter the East wind drifts the snow to fill the lanes. Snow lingers longer and Spring can be a little late - on average growth is 3 weeks behind the nearby valleys. The Summer sun is tempered and Autumn mists roll swiftly away, whilst still hovering on the lower land. Conversely, in late November cloud can blot out the sky for days at a time. Annual rainfall is 30-35 inches.
